Even as a keen viewer of Leverage: Redemption, I was leery of the heist-o-rama tackling esports. And sure, its fake video game is baffling, but I was surprised by how many notes the esports episode hit right. With an Illumatrons team overworked to breaking point by an egotistical owner hawking dangerous supplements, it'll take a con, a frame, fisticuffs, and powerful cheat software to save the day.
Read more
articles.title: TV show Leverage: Redemption has a great esports villain, even if its fake "fighting MOBA" is baffling

articles.author: Sin Vega
articles.description:
I disliked turn-based RPG Kingsvein at first. Quite a bit, in fact. An earlier version of this review would have been a very negative on, filled mostly with complaints and annoyances about opaque and frustrating systems, most of which I've since got over as the intent behind its design has become more clear.
It could definitely explain some things better, and its inscrutably tiny graphics remain a minor nuisance. But it's grown on me a lot, and though it may not be quite the kind of turn-based RPG I get on with best, it's an enjoyable one with a refreshing lack of bloat and timewasting, and with a class and combat system that will be pure catnip to a particular kind of player.
Read more
articles.title: Kingsvein review: monster-splatting RPG goodness that leads with its weak foot

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
The phrase "best foot forwards" implies the second foot will never be as good as the first, and that's unfortunately the case with Nancy Drew: Stay Tuned For Danger. It has a 10/10 pun name and introduces/strengthens concepts that I expect will become series mainstays as we continue with this project, but this is definitely in "difficult second album" territory. I don't hate it! But it's no Secrets Can Kill, and I think that's in part down to increased ambition, as our Nance is called upon to solve a poison pen puzzle at a TV studio.
Read more
articles.title: Nancy Drew: Stay Tuned For Danger is the disappointing second album in this mystery series

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Earlier this week, Blizzard announced what's coming up in Season 3 of Diablo 4, and underneath the mountain's worth of lore and loot updates, there was the surprisingly good news that WASD key controls were finally being added to help provide even more accurate and precise movement in the game over the series' traditional mouse clicks. Not that any of them could decide how to actually pronounce WASD when it came to talking about them on last night's Developer Update stream, though, as there were competing cries of "was-dee", "wased" and "double-you-ey-es-dee" all over the shop as they debated this clearly very "controversial topic" live on air. Read on for more details about what they're hoping to achieve with WASD controls in the game, but more importantly: how do you pronounce WASD? Let's get a poll up asap.  
Read more
articles.title: Diablo 4's Season 3 developer update reignites "controversial topic" of how to pronounce WASD

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
About 20 years ago, a travel company declared this Monday just gone, the 15th, to be the most depressing day of the year. They call it Blue January. Enter yet more studio layoffs. 2023's trend continues with Dead By Daylight developer Behaviour Interactive getting rid of about 45 staff, per Kotaku, while CI Games has laid off 10% of its workforce, including from Lords Of The Fallen studio Hexworks and Sniper Ghost Warrior studio Underdog (via GI.Biz).
Read more
articles.title: More layoffs as Behaviour Interactive and CI Games "adjust scope" and make "optimisations"

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Back in the depths of 2023's February Steam Next Fest, Roots Of Yggdrasil was one of a handful of games that really caught my attention. Not because it was another beautiful-looking deckbuilder (though that does seem to be a steadily growing niche of mine these days), or because its colourful, inkwash visuals had the air of a Norse-flavoured Okami about them (though it did also help). Rather, it was the way its roguelike foundations meshed with its freeform, but still very goal-driven turn-based building systems, giving you drive and purpose in your construction choices, while also being light and chill, with just the right amount of existential threat nipping at your heels.
It struck me that if, say, my best puzzle strategy bud Dorfromantik was ever turned into a roguelike, this is probably a good approximation of what it would look and feel like, which is, frankly, yep, I'd like that game right now, please. Happily, with Roots Of Yggdrasil now approaching its early access launch on January 24th, I'm very happy to report that it's come on leaps and bounds since that Next Fest demo. This is already a very moreish and polished building game, and I've been struggling to tear myself away from it as I guide my longboat of magic Vikings away from their impending Ragnarok.
Read more
articles.title: Roots Of Yggdrasil's gorgeous roguelike citybuilding is a real grower

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
If you want to change your Destiny 2 wizard's appearance, the only current method is to stash your wizard's gear in your vault, create a whole new wizard with a new look (after deleting the old to free a character slot, if needed), grab your old wizard's gear, then optionally replay any story bits to catch up. The MMOFPS has no barber, no surgeon, it's new character or nothing. After six years (longer, if you count the first game), Bungie are finally planning to change this. An upcoming update will introduce the ability to change your character's look—within limits. For drastic changes, you would still need a new wizard.
Read more
articles.title: Destiny 2 will finally let you change your character's appearance, with one big limitation

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
After quite a while using the Fnatic Streak65, a 60% keyboard with Cherry brown switches, I have moved on from fruit (technically drupe, according to Google) and into a vegetable era. My Streak's brown switches became a bit loud and quite rattly, which, as someone with hearing declared by an audiologist to be so sensitive that I give myself tinnitus, started to get to me. 


So I type this to you now as someone who's graduated to Kailh low profile switches, which is proving as nutritious for my finger pads as I'd imagine its leafy homophone would be. Here's hoping that there's more low profile mechanical keebs out there in a few years, as the options seem very limited at the mo.

 
Read more
articles.title: Sorry fruit keyboards, I am now a vegetable keyboard person

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 was featured in this evening's Xbox Developer Direct. Ninja Theory gave a further glimpse of the things they show when talking about Hellblade: motion capture, graphical fidelity, mental health representation, and stabbing. They also provided a release date: May 21st, 2024.

 
Read more
articles.title: Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 will release on May 21st, 2024

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Tonight's Xbox Developer Direct brought an update on Avowed, Obsidian's first-person fantasy RPG. A new trailer provided a substantial look at combat, including pistols, dual-wielding swords and wands, as well as a slightly updated release window: this autumn. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Obsidian's first-person fantasy RPG Avowed is coming this autumn

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The leaks were right. Machine Games' next Nazi-biffer is called Indiana Jones And The Great Circle. It was shown for the first time during this evening's Xbox Developer Direct, where we got to see first-person punching and whipping, some tomb raiding, and plenty of Indy's face in cutscenes. 

We also got a release window: 2024.

 
Read more
articles.title: Indiana Jones And The Great Circle is first-person, stealthy, and coming 2024

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Today's Xbox Developer Direct stream offered updates on some of 2024's biggest Microsoft games, including MachineGames' Indiana Jones And The Great Circle, Obsidian's Avowed and Ninja Theory's Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2. If you missed the stream and want a quick roundup of all the news, games, release dates and trailers featured, we've gathered it all together in this post.

 
Read more
articles.title: Everything announced at today's Xbox Developer Direct 2024

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I think we're well into "milking the gimmick" territory for bodycam horror games now - last week's Digested may have been one giant snake too many - but Zoochosis does have the additional virtue of being heavily inspired by the cute doggy scene from The Thing. And also, perhaps, Five Nights At Freddy's.
In this latest, gruesome escapade from Sparky Marky developers Clapperheads, you are a zookeeper working the night shift. Your job, initially, is to feed the incarcerated animals and clean up after them while giving them an occasional pat on the nose. But Something Is Wrong. Giraffes aren't supposed to have that many legs, or mandibles. Kangaroos aren't supposed to stick to the ceiling, or have several sets of teeth.
  
Read more
articles.title: Animal-loving horror Zoochosis is an open homage to The Thing

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
Games Done Quick is busy raising loads of money for the Prevent Cancer Foundation, so we have a little chat about speedrunning, speedrunners, the benefits of breaking the game vs. the quality of a purist speedrun, and also a dog. We don't have a Nate this week, but James has been playing Apelegs again and offers a surprising self-assessment of how he feels like he's past his Apex Legends prime, and how confidence is a really necessary skill in competitive shooters. Worth tuning in for a listen to that.
Read more
articles.title: The Electronic Wireless Show S3 Episode 2: speedrunning dogs for fun and (charity) profit

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
It’s been two whole graphics card generations since Nvidia last tried the whole Super-branded refresh thing, and from what I recall of that sweaty 2019 summer, most of the updated RTX 20 series cards were meek rejigs of GPUs that didn’t really need replacing in the first place. Having tried the new RTX 4070 Super, though, it looks like Nvidia aren’t just redeeming the Super badge – they might just right the wrongs of the RTX 40 family as a whole.
Read more
articles.title: Nvidia GeForce RTX 4070 Super review: what the RTX 4070 should have been

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
Four months after the troubled launch of Payday 3, developers Starbreeze have announced they've formed a "strike team of veteran developers" with the goal of bringing it "up to where it will meet your expectations". The cooperative heist FPS got off to a right bumpy start when the ever-unpopular decision to only be playable if you're online collided with server issues that saw Starbreeze take the game down for a while. Since then, it has failed to rise above 'Mixed' review rating on Steam, not helped by Starbreeze releasing a £15 DLC pack when many players were unhappy with the game they'd just bought for £35.
Read more
articles.title: Payday 3 forms "strike team" focused on making the co-op FPS finally "meet your expectations"

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Today's the day of Xbox Developer Direct 2024, a select showcase of forthcoming Microsoft-published games, from sorcerous RPGs to intricate strategy games, which begins at 12pm PT, 3pm ET and 8pm UK. Wait, stop! Come back here, you silly goose. You don't need to go anywhere. I've embedded the livestream below, together with the key things you need to know about the games in question.
Read more
articles.title: All today's Xbox Developer Direct 2024 streams in one place

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Your favourite beaver-based colony sim Timberborn's latest big update has arrived, and honestly, I'd say your poor beavers won't appreciate it one bit. The main reason being, it adds a new ecological hazard called Badwater, that doesn't only make your water bad, but your crops and beavers at risk of being bad. Still, there are plenty of new buildings to help you harness the power of the stanky water and errr, exercise halls for beavers to get their sweat on. I wouldn't recommend they rehydrate with the bad water, though.
Read more
articles.title: Beaver colony sim Timberborn's biggest ever update brings a tidal wave of pollution and disease

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Novotný)
articles.description: Tento článek je prvním ze série článků, které se vám budou snažit přiblížit novou databázi evitaDB specializující se na práci s daty v katalogových řešení především v oblasti e-commerce, ale nejen tam.
articles.title: evitaDB: představení rychlé in-memory databáze pro e-commerce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: V předchozím článku jsme si ukázali, jak MicroPython použít pro webový front end, dnes se zaměříme opačnou stranu spektra – na podporu pro zápis funkcí obsahujících instrukce z instrukčních sad Thumb a Thumb-2.
articles.title: Zápis funkcí obsahujících instrukce Thumb a Thumb-2 v MicroPythonu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V úterý 23. ledna proběhl první den setkání CSNOG, které je zaměřeno na provozovatele internetových sítí. Mluvilo se především o budování anycastových sítí, současných bezpečnostních hrozbách a měření výkonu.
articles.title: Testujte síťové prostředí pořádně, jinak vám vyjdou nesmysly (CSNOG 2024)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: V pravidelné středeční softwarové sondě si představíme nástroj pro monitorování systémových zdrojů v GNOME shell, naimportujeme si secrets z GCP nebo AWS do Sealed Secrets a budeme snadno přepínat mezi konfiguracemi gitu.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (24. 1. 2024): monitorujte systémové zdroje

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Luděk Šťastný)
articles.description: Pokud se zajímáte o amatérskou astronomii, máte v Linuxu k dispozici celou paletu pěkných a použitelných nástrojů. Ukážu vám ještě jeden, který má velmi pěkný grafický výstup a navíc obrovský katalog hvězd.
articles.title: Gaia Sky: počítačové planetárium nejen pro potěchu oka

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Projekt MicroPython máme spojený s představou varianty jazyka Python určené pro běh na různých mikrořadičích s omezeným výkonem i malou kapacitou. Ovšem ze stejných důvodů může být MicroPython použit ve webovém prohlížeči.
articles.title: MicroPython ve webovém prohlížeči: lehkotonážní varianta k Pyodide

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Operační systém openSUSE Leap 16 bude založen na nové platformě SUSE Adaptable Linux Platform (ALP). Podle vyjádření šéfa Canonicalu bude Ubuntu 24.04 LTS mít podporu 12 let. Vyšel nový SparkyLinux se správcem oken MLVWM.
articles.title: openSUSE Leap na nové platformě, Ubuntu s podporou na 12 let

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: ČD - Telematika)
articles.description: V dnešním ohlédnutí za uplynulým týdnem odhalíme nové informace týkající se incidentu s počítačovým červem Stuxnet, podíváme se na kloub Androgh0st malware a popíšeme pár nových zranitelností Google Chrome, SSH a SonicWall.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: tvář Stuxnetu odhalena

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Chcete se začít vzdělávat v oboru a někam se posunout? MPSV spustilo Databázi kurzů digitálního vzdělávání a uhradí vám až 82 % kurzovného. Máme pro vás několik školení týkajících se Linuxu a počítačových sítí.
articles.title: Staňte se linuxákem, síťařem a hackerem, úřad práce vám na to přispěje

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vylepšení enginu Servo pro embedded aplikace, podpora vypnutí grafického enginu na RDNA3 Radeonech při běhu ROCm, Hangover míří k podpoře RISC-V, KDE vylepšuje neceločíselné škálování.
articles.title: Microsoft zvyšuje minimum na 16 GB RAM kvůli AI, FreeRDP vyřešilo problémy s Waylandem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Více než 5 300 instancí GitLabu je zranitelných vůči chybě s označením CVE-2023–7028, na kterou GitLab upozornil začátkem tohoto měsíce.
articles.title: Více než 5300 serverů GitLab vystaveno útoku umožňujícímu převzít účet

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Ubuntu 23.04 Lunar Lobster dosáhlo 25. ledna 2024 konce své životnosti. Znamená to, že již nebude podporováno a nebude tedy dostávat žádné další technické ani bezpečnostní aktualizace. Pokud tuto verzi stále používáte, je nejvyšší čas aktualizovat na následující verzi Ubuntu 23.10 Mantic Minotaur.
articles.title: Ubuntu 23.04 Lunar Lobster je na konci podpory

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: ArgoCD je GitOps nástroj kterým nasazujeme aplikace do Kubernetes. Pracuje na základě deklarativních konfiguračních souborů, které si stahuje z Gitu. To znamená, že vše, co commitneme do repozitáře, se na nasadí do Kubernetes. O všech změnách: co, kdy, kdo udělal budeme mít přehledné záznamy v Gitu.
articles.title: ArgoCD: nasazujeme aplikace do Kubernetes (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Po Firefoxu 122 je na světě i Chrome / Chromium 121. Opravuje celkem 17 bezpečnostních chyb, včetně tří CVE s vysokým skóre. Mezi novinkami najdeme několik věcí v rámci podporovaných CSS prvků, EditContext API, AI pro uspořádání panelů, Remote Playback API pro elementy typu HTML media, aktualizaci API pravidel spekulací a vylepšení WebGPU.
articles.title: Chrome 121 s několika CSS a WebGPU novinkami

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Jelikož AMD vyvíjí vše pro Linux v rámci GPUOpen otevřené a univerzálně použitelné, může nyní Intel pro svůj Vulkan ovladač a tedy svá GPU nabídnout podporu využití nástroje Radeon Memory Visualizer. Intel ANV Mesa ovladač odteď umí poskytovat výpisy paměti, které jsou kompatibilní s Radeon Memory Visualizer.
articles.title: Vulkan ovladač Intel ANV dostává podporu AMD Radeon Memory Visualizeru

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Požadavek na začlenění této nyní již postarší novinky v balíku FFmpeg se v projektu OBS Studio objevila loni v květnu. Nyní se tak stalo a podpora kódování videa do formátu AV1 přes rozhraní VA-API tak bude k dispozici s příštím vydáním OBS Studia.
articles.title: OBS Studio konečně začlení podporu AV1 přes VA-API

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Náhledy obrázků a popis hesla jsou nově ve Firefoxu 122 zobrazovány u výsledků vyhledávání v našeptávači, jak to známe u prohlížečů na bázi projektu Chromium. Vylepšena je kvalita překladu stránek, neměli bychom už vídat to, kdy obsah stránky při překladu zmizí, nebo se rozbije příslušný widget.
articles.title: Vyšel Firefox 122 s náhledy obrázků v našeptávači výsledků vyhledávání

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: V rámci BSD se vede diskuse, kterou Linux zažil před řadou měsíců. Diskutuje se o vpuštění Rustu do základu systému a o výhodnosti takové změny. Vývojář Alan Somers vše v sobotu sepsal do přehledu podle jednotlivých částí systému.
articles.title: Vývojáři FreeBSD diskutují zavedení jazyka Rust

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Tomáš Heřmánek)
articles.description: Přemýšleli jste někdy nad tím, jak zautomatizovat a centralizovat správu rolí v PostgreSQL prostřednictvím napojení na externího autentizačního providera, např. Active Directory? Ve středu 24. ledna 2024 na bezplatném webináři vás celou touto problematikou provede zkušený lektor Jakub Zemanek. Ukáže vám možnosti a způsoby napojení na GSSAPI, včetně automatizace přidávání rolí na základě skupin v Active Directory nebo FreeIPA, včetně praktické ukázky.
articles.title: Webináře zdarma - PostgreSQL a Zabbbix

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Populární službě Trello unikla databáze uživatelů, která čítá 15 milionů položek. Útočník vystupující pod jménem emo celou databázi nabízí k prodeji a tvrdí, že obsahuje e-mailové adresy, uživatelská jména, skutečná jména a další podrobnosti o účtu. Zatím nic nenaznačuje tomu, že by ze služby unikla hesla. Data unikla 16. ledna letošního roku.
articles.title: Službě Trello unikla databáze 15 milionů uživatelů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Společnost Seagate završila skoro 15 let běžící vývoj technologie heat-assisted magnetic recording (HAMR) a její první disk míří na trh, konkrétně model Exos s kapacitou 30 TB. Počítá přitom se stejnou životností jako u standardních pevných disků, které jsou nyní na trhu.
articles.title: Seagate Exos 30TB, první disk s HAMR jde do prodeje

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Pro Fedoru 40 bylo navrženo používat nástroj iotop-c místo iotop. Oba nástroje zobrazují IO aktivitu podobně jako top či htop aktivitu CPU. Ale iotop v Pythonu je prakticky deset let neaktualizovaný. Oproti tomu iotop-c je aktivně vyvíjen a je napsán v C a u jeho zrodu stál Tomáš Matějíček.
articles.title: Fedora 40 bude používat iotop-c místo iotop

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Andrea Righi z Canonicalu o svátcích napsal pro zábavu externí plánovač CPU linuxového jádra v Rustu sched-ext. Ten je kupodivu pro některé zátěže (například hry) lepší než ten výchozí v linuxovém jádře a to včetně novinky z 6.6 EEVDF.
articles.title: Plánovač CPU v Rustu je lepší než ten výchozí v linuxovém jádře

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Prohlížeč Brave odstraní striktní ochranu před otisky prohlížeče. Jednak to rozbíjí spoustu webových stránek a také to používá pouze asi jen 0,5 % uživatelů.
articles.title: Brave odstraní striktní ochranu před otisky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Jens Axboe vylepšil dva IO plánovače MQ-Deadline a BFQ tak že dosahují lepšího výkonu. Na rychlém NVMe zařízení dosahuje nyní Deadline 2,4× více IOPS a BFQ 2,7× více IOPS.
articles.title: IO plánovače Deadline a BFQ budou zrychleny více než 2×

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: johny)
articles.description: S novou verziou vývojovej platformy .NET 8 vyšiel aj jazyk C# 12. Na rozdiel od posledných pár rokov, keď jazyk prešiel dramatickými zmenami, najnovšia verzia prináša len zopár zmien. Ukážeme si tri podstatnejšie zmeny.
articles.title: Novinky C# 12

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Velký zájem o nové eDoklady přetížil dnes Identitu občana. Ministerstvo práce a sociálních věcí také hlásí problémy s přihlašováním do jejich aplikace Jenda.
articles.title: Velký zájem o eDoklady přetížil Identitu občana

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nedávno bylo schváleno zavedení eDokladů, ke kterému mělo dojít v lednu letošního roku. Slíbená aplikace eDoklady už je dostupná pro Android. Pro iOS bude brzy, ještě dnes nebo zítra. Pro nahrání občanského průkazu budete potřebovat Identitu občana. V ní se prokazujete několika způsoby, například Bankovní identitou nebo MojeID.
articles.title: Aplikace eDoklady už je pro Android, pro iOS bude brzy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Ve věku 85 let ve středu zemřel David L. Mills. V roce 1985 vytvořil NTP (network time protocol), kterým se synchronizuje přesný čas mezi počítači prakticky doposud.
articles.title: Ve věku 85 let zemřel David L. Mills, vynálezce NTP

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Bezpečnostní experti z firmy Trail of Bits v úterý zveřejnili zranitelnost GPU Apple, Qualcomm a AMD nazvanou LeftoverLocals (CVE-2023–4969). GPU NVIDIA a ARM nejsou zranitelné. Jde o nedostatečné mazání grafické paměti při použití AI. Potom jiný proces může číst například výstupy velkého jazykového modelu.
articles.title: Zranitelnost GPU LeftoverLocals

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Chcete se stát datovým analytikem s přesahem do datového inženýrství a v budoucnu se věnovat třeba i strojovému učení či AI? Pak je tu pro vás půlroční intenzivní kurz Datový analytik s Pythonem, kterým vás jednou týdně ve 24 lekcích provedou zkušení lektoři s komerční praxí. Nejbližší kurz začíná už 15. února.
articles.title: Staňte se datovým analytikem s Pythonem (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Tradiční konference InstallFest se letos v březnu opět uskuteční, zapište si do kalendáře víkend 16. a 17. března. Na akci se setkávají začátečníci s ostřílenými linuxáky, kteří jim pomáhají s nejrůznějšími problémy, které vyžadují více zkušeností. Setkání proběhne opět na FEL ČVUT na Karlově náměstí v Praze.
articles.title: InstallFest proběhne 16. a 17. března, přihlaste svou přednášku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Hans Reiser, tvůrce souborového systému ReiserFS, je v současnosti za vraždu ve vězení. Fredrick Brennan mu napsal dopis a před pár měsíci obdržel dlouhou odpověď, kterou nyní zveřejnil na LKML.
articles.title: Hans Reiser se omluvil za svoje chyby

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Tento pátek je posledním dnem, kdy je možné se přihlásit na komunitní setkání nejen českých a slovenských správců sítí – CSNOG 2024. Akce se koná 23. a 24. ledna na Univerzitě Tomáše Bati ve Zlíně.
articles.title: Blíží se CSNOG 2024, registrace končí 19. ledna

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Na konci minulého týdne jsme psali o tom, že Linus Torvalds je kvůli zimní bouři odříznut od internetu a přestal tedy pracovat na vývoji jádra. Linus průběžně informoval na Mastodonu o zlepšující se situaci, podle poslední zprávy se začalo oteplovat a dodavatel elektřiny slibuje brzké obnovení dodávek. Lidé prý už začínají vyjíždět auty ven, což podle všeho ještě není úplně bezpečné. Nemám zájem účastnit se tohoto konkrétního kontaktního sportu, a proto stále nevycházím z domu, i když obavy ze zamrzlých trubek pomalu mizí, píše Linus.
articles.title: Linus Torvalds je zpět a přijímá kód pro jádro 6.8

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: V závěru roku se sešla dlouhá řada vydání, z těch větších FreeBSD nebo OpenMandriva. Aktualizovány byly také linuxové distribuce EndeavourOS, IPFire, Proxmox, RLXOS, Ultramarine Linux, 4MLinux, NixOS, SpiralLinux, Tails, Kali Linux, Raspberry Pi OS, Alpine Linux či Debian.
articles.title: Distribuční novinky 47-49/2023

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Fortinet oznamuje bezpečné síťové řešení s podporou Wi-Fi 7. Sedm technologických trendů: využití API pro umělou inteligenci a vývoj softwaru s pomocí AI. Podle IDC se výdaje na řešení GenAI letos zdvojnásobí a v roce 2027 vzrostou na 151 miliard dolarů. Polovina firem zažila v roce 2023 kybernetický útok nebo incident, který jim znemožnil přístup k datům. Přístupové údaje do eGovernmentu nepatří.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Polovina firem zažila v roce 2023 kybernetický útok nebo incident, který jim znemožnil přístup k datům

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 3/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Extrapolace nulového šumu, kvantové spinové sklo a další nápady ve světě kvantových počítačů. Hustota temné energie nemusí být konstantní. Supermasivní černé díry v centrech raných galaxií jsou mnohem hmotnější. K čemu je houbám psilocybin? ESA se chystá na návrat k Venuši.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Jak zvýšit životnost qubitů?

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Už jste unaveni z obrazovky s pirátskou kopií Windows, nebo vás snad rozčilují upozornění na jejich aktivaci? Máme pro vás dobrou zprávu. Na Goodoffer24.com totiž prodáváme doživotní licence na Windows  10 a Windows 11 s velkými slevami. K tomu ještě máme speciální promokód, díky kterému jsou ceny ještě nižší.
articles.title: Novoroční prodej s 91% slevou! Windows jen za €12 – Goodoffer24

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: GFI Software: pouze 31 % SMB firem je dobře připraveno na kybernetický útok. Vědci navrhli novou podobu Turingova testu pro éru umělé inteligence. 2024: rok útoků pomocí AI. Datová centra jako klíčová úložiště. Nové počítače Swift Go přinášejí umělou inteligenci a procesory Intel Core Ultra. Nová řada notebooků Dell XPS: Futuristický design s vestavěnou umělou inteligencí.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Vědci navrhli novou podobu Turingova testu pro éru umělé inteligence

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 2/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Jak je možné, že se ze sodíku stane izolant? Proč je moč žlutá? Na ČVUT vyvinuli systém, který s pomocí umělé inteligence detekuje střelbu i typ zbraně.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Gravitační vlny mohou být i důsledkem fúze bosonových hvězd

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: 7 kybernetických hrozeb pro rok 2024, před kterými varují čeští experti. Budoucnost daňařů je v datové analytice. Trhy v roce 2023 a co čekat letos. Automobilový průmysl čeká revoluce v ukládání dat.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Budoucnost daňařů je v datové analytice

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Shrnutí roku 2023. Detekce kapalné vody a života na exoplanetách: schází oxid uhličitý, v atmosféře je ozon. Jak se chová voda u elektrod.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: V jádrech neutronových hvězd má být kvarková hmota

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 1/2024

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová stabilní verze 2.7.0 nástroje pro práci se zašifrovanými soubory nebo diskovými oddíly cryptsetup. Přináší podporu hardwarového OPAL šifrování disků.
articles.title: Cryptsetup 2.7.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Ministerstvo dopravy na 𝕏: eTechničák už i na Google Play. I na Androidu si můžete po naskenování QR kódu z nového osvědčení o registraci vozidla nebo zadání VIN kódu zkontrolovat data o vašem vozidle v registru silničních vozidel. Připomínáme, že kromě aplikace eTechničák je možné pro přístup k datům v registru silničních vozidel využít také web dataovozidlech.cz, případně Portál dopravy nebo Portál občana.
articles.title: eTechničák už i na Google Play

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Zed je editor kódů od autorů editoru Atom a Tree-sitter. Nově se jedná o open source software (editor GPL, serverové komponenty AGPL, UI framework Apache 2).
articles.title: Editor kódů Zed

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 6.0 linuxové distribuce Parrot OS (Wikipedie). Přehled novinek v příspěvku na blogu. Jedná se o linuxovou distribuci založenou na Debianu a zaměřenou na penetrační testování, digitální forenzní analýzu, reverzní inženýrství, hacking, anonymitu nebo kryptografii.
articles.title: Parrot OS 6.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Turris OS, operační systém pro síťová zařízení Turris postavený na OpenWrt, byl vydán v nové verzi 6.5.0. Řešeny jsou mimo jiné bezpečnostní chyby v Curlu a Sambě.
articles.title: Turris OS 6.5.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Osobní počítač Apple Macintosh dnes slaví 40 let. Na trh byl uveden 24. ledna 1984 a součástí jeho reklamní kampaně byla televizní reklama natočená Ridley Scottem, která parafrázovala román 1984 anglického spisovatele George Orwella.
articles.title: Apple Macintosh slaví 40 let

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Google Chrome 121 byl prohlášen za stabilní. Nejnovější stabilní verze 121.0.6167.85 přináší řadu oprav a vylepšení (YouTube). Opraveno bylo 17 bezpečnostních chyb. Vylepšeny byly také nástroje pro vývojáře.
articles.title: Google Chrome 121

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byl vydán Mozilla Firefox 122.0. Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání, poznámkách k vydání pro firmy a na stránce věnované vývojářům. Nově jsou k dispozici upstream balíčky pro Ubuntu, Debian a Linux Mint. Řešeny jsou rovněž bezpečnostní chyby. Nový Firefox 122 je již k dispozici také na Flathubu a Snapcraftu.
articles.title: Firefox 122.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: V pátek 19. a sobotu 20. ledna proběhl v novém sídle Nejvyššího kontrolního úřadu (NKÚ) Hackathon veřejné správy 5.0. Publikovány byly vytvořené aplikace. V kategorii původní projekty získala první místo aplikace ŠKOLKAPLUS a v kategorii nové projekty aplikace MŮŽU ZDE?
articles.title: Aplikace vytvořené na Hackathonu veřejné správy 5.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Problémy s Identitou občana přetrvávají. Problémy má například eRecept (V souvislosti se spuštěním mobilní aplikace eDoklady je aktuálně téměř nedostupná identifikace osoby v základních registrech a Identitou občana. Vzhledem k tomu, že tuto identifikaci využívá i systém eRecept (vyzvednutí léků prostřednictvím dokladu totožnosti, přihlášení se do aplikací eRecept), tak aktuální nedostupnost identifikačního prostředku způsobuje problémy i zde.) nebo Jenda MPSV (Evidujeme problémy s přihlašováním NIA). Ministerstvo práce a sociálních věcí se navíc stalo terčem útoku typu DDoS.
articles.title: Problémy s Identitou občana přetrvávají.  MPSV terčem útoku typu DDoS

articles.description: Following this morning's embargo lift on the Vulkan Roadmap 2024 specification, Mesa merge requests were opened by Intel and RADV stakeholders in beginning to implement the new extensions for these Mesa Vulkan drivers and promoting existing extensions to their newly-minted state...
articles.title: Open-Source Intel & AMD Drivers Make Quick Progress On Vulkan Roadmap 2024 Extensions

articles.description: While we are beginning to see AMD Zen 4C cores in client systems, these smaller cores have already proven themselves very interesting and capable with the AMD EPYC Bergamo high core count server processors and the extremely power efficient EPYC 8004 "Siena" processors. For showing how far Zen has come in power efficiency, I thought it would be fun to show how the original flagship EPYC 7601 "Zen 1" processor with 32-cores / 64-threads compared to Zen 4C with the EPYC 8324P(N) 32-core processors. But as that isn't even the top-end Siena part, I also tossed in the 64-core EPYC 8534PN too for a top of stack look for the current EPYC 8004 line-up.
articles.title: The Incredible Performance & Power Efficiency Of AMD Zen 1 vs. Zen 4C

articles.description: For the better part of two years we've seen Intel open-source software engineers working on preparing the Linux kernel for FRED, the Flexible Return and Event Delivery for defining new transitions for changing privilege levels. Intel's been working hard on the FRED kernel plumbing for better performance, lower response times, and improved robustness and it's looking like FRED could be set to land come Linux 6.9...
articles.title: Intel's FRED Looks Like It Could Be Ready For Linux 6.9

articles.description: The Khronos Group today announced their Vulkan Roadmap 2024 milestone as a specification for their latest API features and meeting the needs of 2024 graphics processors and other hardware. Vulkan Roadmap 2024 builds upon Vulkan 1.3 and the Vulkan Roadmap 2022 specifications to deliver next-generation capabilities...
articles.title: Vulkan Roadmap 2024 Brings Shader Quad Control, Shader Maximal Reconvergence & More

articles.description: GNOME Network Displays is the software that allows streaming your GNOME desktop to WiFi Display devices using PipeWire. Last week GNOME Network Displays 0.91 was released with some big improvements to this software...
articles.title: GNOME Network Displays Adds Support For Chromecast & Miracast MICE Protocols

articles.description: In addition to OBS adding AV1 VA-API support, some more good Linux video acceleration news this week is Valve enabling VA-API DRM hardware-accelerated video decoding when using Remote Play with the newest Steam beta...
articles.title: Steam Beta Adds VA-API DRM Video Acceleration For Remote Play

articles.description: Intel engineers on Wednesday released OpenVINO 2023.3 as the latest major update to this leading open-source AI toolkit. The OpenVINO 2023.3 brings "full support" for new Emerald Rapids and Meteor Lake processors, other Intel hardware support improvements, and continuing to expand support around generative AI (GenAI) and large language models (LLMs)...
articles.title: OpenVINO 2023.3 Brings Full Support For Intel Emerald Rapids, Broader GenAI & LLMs

articles.description: Eric Engestrom with Igalia continues doing a stellar job maintaining the Mesa 23.3 stable series while also leading the Mesa 24.0 release candidates for that upcoming Q1'2024 stable series...
articles.title: Mesa 24.0-rc3 Up For Testing, Mesa 23.3.4 Out As Stable

articles.description: Earlier this month the GCC 14 compiler landed initial support for AMD RDNA3 "GFX11" graphics processors as part of the GNU Compiler Collection's OpenMP device offloading support for GPU compute. That initial support was rather basic but a follow-up patch has the possibility of making the RDNA3 (GFX11) support "working for most purposes" and will hopefully still be merged in time for the GCC 14.1 stable release...
articles.title: GCC 14 Compiler Might Have AMD RDNA3 GPU Support "Working For Most Purposes"

articles.description: The Zed code editor being led by the creators of the Atom editor and Tree-sitter syntax parsing framework have announced today that the Zed editor is being open-sourced...
articles.title: Zed Code Editor Now Open-Source

articles.description: AMD announced back during CES the Radeon RX 7600 XT as a $329 USD graphics card for 1080p/1440p gaming. Today that card goes on sale and the review embargo has lifted. Here is an initial look at the AMD Radeon RX 7600 XT performance under Linux with AMD's open-source driver stack.
articles.title: AMD Radeon RX 7600 XT Linux Performance

articles.description: For going along with today's GeForce RTX 4070 Ti SUPER graphics card launch (Linux review in the days ahead due to late arrival of my RTX 40 series hardware), NVIDIA has published their first R550 series Linux driver beta. The NVIDIA 550.40.07 Linux driver is now available with many bug fixes and a few new features...
articles.title: NVIDIA 550 Linux Beta Driver Released With Many Fixes, VR Displays & Better (X)Wayland

articles.description: Teflon has been merged into Mesa 24.1 as a Gallium3D front-end that TensorFlow can load for delegating the execution of operations in a neural network model. Teflon was created initially for the Etnaviv Gallium3D driver for being able to run AI inferencing on Vivante NPUs...
articles.title: Teflon Merged To Mesa 24.1 As Gallium3D Frontend For TensorFlow Lite

articles.description: Red Hat's Richard Hughes has released Fwupd 1.9.12 as the newest update to this open-source firmware updating solution that is developed along with the Linux Vendor Firmware Service (LVFS) for simplifying system firmware and peripheral/device firmware updates under Linux...
articles.title: Fwupd 1.9.12 Adds Support For More Devices & AMD CPU Checks Updated

articles.description: Following discussions from last year's Linux Plumbers Conference, a Windows NT synchronization primitive driver has been proposed for the Linux kernel. This driver would expose /dev/ntsync as a new character device for implementing some of the Windows NT synchronization primitives directly within the Linux kernel. In turn this would help the performance of some Windows games/applications running on Linux via Wine and in some cases would mean significantly better performance...
articles.title: Windows NT Sync Driver Proposed For The Linux Kernel - Better Wine Performance

articles.description: The cross-platform OBS software that is popular with game streamers and others live-recording their desktops has finally landed support for AV1 video encoding using Linux's Video Acceleration API (VA-API) interface...
articles.title: OBS Merges FFmpeg VA-API AV1 Support

articles.description: AMD's GPUOpen team today released version 1.4.33 of the Advanced Media Framework (AMF) SDK. The AMF SDK continues to be focused on delivering optimal access to AMD hardware for multimedia processing under both Windows and Linux...
articles.title: AMD's Advanced Media Framework Adds Pro Vulkan & Experimental RADV Support

articles.description: While AMD's GPUOpen team developed the Radeon Memory Visualizer for their own Radeon graphics processors, thanks to the software working out well and being open-source and the profiling/dump format being public, the Intel open-source Vulkan Linux driver has added support for it. With the Intel ANV Mesa driver you can now generate Radeon Memory Visualizer (RMV) compatible dumps that can then be loaded into the GPUOpen software for analyzing the video memory behavior of Intel's integrated and discrete graphics...
articles.title: Intel's Open-Source Vulkan Driver Wired Up To Support AMD's Radeon Memory Visualizer

articles.description: In addition to Firefox 122 making it to stable today, Google has also promoted their Chrome 121 web browser to its stable channel...
articles.title: Chrome 121 Adds New CSS & WebGPU Features

articles.description: It's 2024 and sadly the real-time (RT) patches still have yet to be mainlined for the Linux kernel. At least though the out-of-tree patches continue to be quickly re-based and decrease in size over time... Out today is the Linux v6.8-rc1-rt1 patches for bringing the real-time support against the in-development Linux 6.8 kernel...
articles.title: Real-Time Patches Updated Against The Linux 6.8 Kernel

articles.description: The review embargo has now expired on the Framework Laptop 16, the latest innovative and upgradeable laptop from this company that has made quite a name for itself with modular and user-upgradeable laptop designs for both AMD and Intel. The new Framework Laptop 16 offers even more customizability around the keyboard/touchpad and other options including over using a Radeon RX 7700S graphics module and more. Besides the immense customizability options and upgrades available with the Framework Laptop 16, the new model employs the AMD Ryzen 7040HS processor for even greater performance over the AMD Ryzen 7040U found with the latest Framework 13 model.
articles.title: Framework Laptop 16 Delivers Great Linux Support & Performance, Excellent Customizability

articles.description: Over the weekend I shared some benchmarks showing some nice performance gains with Linux 6.7 over the 6.6 kernel when running on the AMD Ryzen Threadripper 7980X HEDT processor within the new System76 Thelio. So now you may be wondering about the performance with the in-development Linux 6.8 kernel... Here are some early tests there...
articles.title: Linux 6.8 Running Well On The AMD Threadripper 7980X, Maintaining Gains Made With v6.7

articles.description: While Intel's Sierra Forest as their first all-E-core Xeon processor with up to 288 cores per socket isn't launching until around the middle of this calendar year, Intel Linux engineers already sent out their first kernel patch in beginning to target its successor: Clearwater Forest...
articles.title: Intel Sends Out First Linux Patch For Clearwater Forest

articles.description: The Gentoo Linux project published a 2023 retrospective on Monday that outlines their ongoing high level of development, gaining three new developers over the past calendar year, and various initiatives embarked on by the developers...
articles.title: Gentoo Made Progress In 2023 On Binary Packages, Modern C & Reviving DEC Alpha Support

articles.description: Today marks the first Mozilla Firefox feature release of 2024 with quite a number of new features to showcase in the newly-published Firefox 122...
articles.title: Firefox 122 Available With Official Debian Package, Many Web Improvements

articles.description: Valve has rolled out Proton 8.0-5 as the newest version of their Wine downstream for powering Steam Play to enjoy mass amounts of Windows games to run rather well on Linux...
articles.title: Valve Releases Proton 8.0-5 With Many Fixes, More Windows Games Now Playable

articles.description: For those wanting to use an open-source Coreboot-based firmware on your desktop with modern hardware, a rare and leading option is 3mdeb's Coreboot-based "Dasharo" firmware on select MSI Z690/Z790 motherboards...
articles.title: Coreboot-Based Dasharo Firmware Updated For MSI Z690/Z790 Motherboards

articles.description: A change merged today for the Linux 6.8 kernel intentionally following yesterday's Linux 6.8-rc1 is a move to enable the "-Wstringop-overflow" compiler option by default...
articles.title: Linux 6.8 Now Enables -Wstringop-overflow To Warn About Buffer Overflows

articles.description: As part of the NVIDIA GeForce RTX 40 series launch RTX Remix was announced for helping game modders remaster older game titles for RTX/ray-tracing. RTX Remix 0.1 debuted last April as the initial version of their software to provide path-tracing support for classic games. Out today is the latest work for helping to remaster classic games with the debut of RTX Remix 0.4...
articles.title: NVIDIA RTX Remix 0.4 Released With Updated DXVK, Performance Improvements & Fixes

articles.description: FreeBSD developers are currently weighing the benefits and costs of allowing the Rust programming language to be used within the FreeBSD base system...
articles.title: FreeBSD Considers Making Use Of Rust Within Its Base System

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
Three years ago, base builder and space simulation game Dyson Sphere Program was released and quite frankly blew my mind. I had already invested over 1,000 hours in Factorio and over 100 hours into Satisfactory, so I knew Dyson Sphere Program would be a game for me. What I didn't expect, however, was the massive scope of the game.


If you haven't played it—you really owe it to yourself to—Dyson Sphere Program basically drops you onto a planet in a bigger solar system, where you have to build up functioning factories to harvest the resources on the planet and tech up. Eventually, you'll leave that planet to find others with different resources, then set up a massive solar system-spanning production line that eventually expands across the galaxy. All of this with one goal in mind: to build …
articles.title: Interview: Dyson Sphere Program producer talks Dark Fog update and the future

articles.author: Joseph Luster
articles.description:
If you thought the idea of a live-action Final Fantasy XIV series sounded like a massive undertaking, you'd be right. One of the executive producers, Dinesh Shamdasani of Hivemind Entertainment, recently confirmed that the project has been canceled. 


When asked about the status of the live-action Final Fantasy XIV on Twitter, Shamdasani straight up said it's "dead." While they had a "fantastic pilot script" by Ben Lustig and Jake Thornton (Winter's Knight) and a multi-season plan, everything was rejected. According to Shamdasani, it was the risk inherent to the "size and scale" of the project that ultimately did it in. Apparently, Amazon came the closest to footing the bill for this one. 




Writer Jake Thornton chimed in, as well, citing Covid as one of the culprits behind the decision. "We took it out just as studios began to zip up their purse strings," Thornton added. 


As for whether or not animation would be more suitable for something like Final Fantasy XIV, Shamdasani was quick to put an end to any further hope for the series, at least for now. Not only did he say that animation would be more difficult, he mentioned that they no longer have the rights to the title. 


Eorzea out of sight


Plans for the live-action Final Fantasy XIV were first revealed back in 2019, and had Square Enix teaming up with Sony Pictures Television and Hivemind. The initial announcement promised a new story set in Eorzea along with series mainstays like Chocobos, airships, and even the "live-action debut of Cid." 


Hivemind previously worked with Netflix on The Witcher and with Amazon on The Expanse, so the experience and potential was there. For the time being, at least we'll always have Dad of Light. 

The post Live-action Final Fantasy XIV series canceled due to ‘size and scale’  appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Live-action Final Fantasy XIV series canceled due to ‘size and scale’

articles.author: Jeff Scott
articles.description:
Announced in September, we've been awaiting confirmation as to when the Horizon Forbidden West Complete Edition would launch on PC. Today, Sony gave us our answer. 


The Complete Edition dropped for PlayStation 5 on October 6. It brought with it a slew of bonus content on top of the revered Burning Shores expansion. All of this will be included within the PC Horizon Forbidden West Complete Edition, now slated to release on March 21.




The majority of the PC Complete Edition's content is similar to that of the PlayStation 5 version, But the PC port has some additional bells and whistles that will excite those with more heftier hardware. PC players will have the option to unlock frame rates, personalize their graphics settings, and enjoy advanced performance features like NVIDIA's DLSS 3 upscaling and frame generation.


As for monitors, ultra-wide support has been implemented so that PC players can enjoy all of Forbidden West's incredible environments. You'll have the ability to go as far as a triple monitor setup, with resolution options including 21:9, 32:9, and 48:9.


Mouse and keyboard controls are fully customizable, of course. Steam Input support is implemented so that you can remap your controller of choice. Including the PlayStation DualSense which allows PC players to enjoy Guerilla Games' use of the controller's haptic feedback abilities. 


As for the Complete Edition's bonus content, there are a handful of new outfits and weapons that will be available for download. Also included are a resource pack, an Apex Clawstrider Machine Strike Piece, and an exclusive Photo Mode pose and face paint that's only in the Complete Edition. You can get the full breakdown over on the PlayStation Blog.


PC players can begin playing the Horizon Forbidden West Complete Edition on March 21. If you've yet to check out Forbidden West, you should. It's pretty great. 

The post Horizon Forbidden West Complete Edition ventures onto PC in March appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Horizon Forbidden West Complete Edition ventures onto PC in March

articles.author: Joseph Luster
articles.description:
While I wouldn't say I'm bad at games by any stretch, I know a game I'll be bad at when I see one. NanoApostle is one such game, and the frenetic boss rush actioner from developer 18Light Game (Pronty) is due out on PC in summer 2024. 


Who cares if I'll be bad at it, though. You might not be! It certainly seems exciting enough, and the intense boss battles at its core are on full display in the announcement trailer from publisher PQube. 




NanoApostle puts you in the role of a nanomachine-augmented child named Anita. As she attempts to escape a top secret facility, she comes face to face with a bunch of cybernetic experiments that certainly seem to have "gone wrong." Or maybe they've gone exactly as their creator intended? Either way, she has to beat 'em all up using a "Destruction Point" battle system. As the name implies, this involves using Anita's Apostle nanites to identify structural weaknesses in enemies and land decisive hits.


Destined to die


The stages themselves are something you'll have to contend with, too. Some of the environments will warp and advance as bosses become more aggressive. As one might expect from a game like NanoApostle, it results in the need for a lot of well-timed dodging and parrying. You'll also need to be strategic with the way you utilize skill points to decide upon your personal approach to combat. 


It all looks and sounds very cool, even if it smacks of a game that I'll pick up and get frustrated with almost immediately. For a lot of folks, that's a key selling point, and I can't say I'm not immediately drawn in by the promise of any game that falls in the Oops! All Bosses! category a la Furi. Hey, why not, bring on the punishment.

The post Sci-Fi boss rush game NanoApostle looks tough as hell, launches this summer appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Sci-Fi boss rush game NanoApostle looks tough as hell, launches this summer

articles.author: Cameron Woolsey
articles.description:
Tower Bosses in Palworld are tough to take down due to their powerful skills and massive health pools. It sure would be great if you can capture them, right? Actually, as of now, you can use a glitch or exploit to capture tower bosses in Palworld. 


The glitch seems to have been discovered by a user on Reddit a few days ago. Following the patch on January 25 for both Steam and Xbox versions, the exploit still exists. I managed to capture two Zoe & Grizzbolt Tower Bosses for my Palworld team using the glitch. 


Steps to capture tower bosses in Palworld using a glitch


I would say the best thing about this glitch is how simple it is to pull off. I attempted it four times and managed to capture two bosses, giving me a 50/50 chance to get away with it. 




To get a boss on your team, you'r…
articles.title: Surprising Palworld glitch lets you catch tower bosses for your own party

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
Are you tired of long-running live service games with no end in sight? Well, Bushiroad's Love Live! School Idol Festival 2 MIRACLE LIVE! isn't just getting a global launch date; it's also getting a global closure date, at the same time.


In a tweet from the SIF account, the company says it is "excited to break the news to you that the global version of Love Live! School Idol Festival 2 MIRACLE LIVE! is launching soon in February 2024." Then, in the next paragraph: "However, we also want to inform you that, the Global Version will close its doors on May 31, 2024, and cease in-app purchases accordingly."




It is a little surreal, to see a launch and closure in the same tweet like that. Mobile games spinning up, making their cash, and closing down later isn't exactly news, but doing it all in one fell swoop? Incredible.


Grand opening, grand closing


As the text notes, this is the global version specifically. Per Gematsu, the School Idol Festival 2 opened its doors in Japan for iOS and Android on April 15, 2023. It's also closing earlier than the global version, on March 31, 2024. So while the global version won't make it three months, the game as a whole will not have made it a full year on either version.


Part of me has to wonder whether this is due to some sort of obligation, that the global version is even going live at all. Or maybe this is just the most nihilistic take on mobile gacha games yet.


The games industry has not been easy on anybody lately, so I do have a lot of sympathy for the developers who put work into making something for the Love Live! fans and have to see their work disappear so fast. Maybe a third School Idol Festival will see more time in the light than this particular entry in the Love Live! canon.

The post New Love Live! mobile game will launch globally in February, then close in May appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: New Love Live! mobile game will launch globally in February, then close in May

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Dejobaan Games and Petricore Inc. have announced that the remaster of their 2009 indie classic, AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!! Remastered, has launched today on PC.


For those keeping score, this is actually the second remake of AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!! – A Reckless Disregard for Gravity. The first time was back in 2011 with AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!! for the Awesome. AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!! Remastered is a heck of a lot shinier than the last time around, benefiting from over a decade of base-jumping advancements.




If you’re unfamiliar, the AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!! series is about base-jumping, but rather than just put you in some boring city, you’re dropped in abstract spaces populated by floating buildings and other pieces of debris. It plays a bit like a rail shooter, w…
articles.title: AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!! Remastered has dropped onto PC

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
According to reporting from Kotaku, Black Forest Games has announced the termination of 50% of its overall workforce, which was said to be around 110 employees in 2023. They join a growing list of layoffs experienced in the industry, which continues to accelerate from last year.


Black Forest Games is a German Developer who was responsible for Giana Sisters: Twisted Dreams, Titan Quest, and the recent Destroy All Humans remasters. They are currently working on an adaptation of the comic book mini-series, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Last Ronin.  


Black Forest Games is a subsidiary of THQ Nordic who, in turn, is a subsidiary of Embracer Group, a publisher who was rather central in the mass of layoffs that occurred through 2023. The company spent much of last year cutting back staff throughout all its many subsidiaries, following explosive expansionism and the fall-through of a large investment.


A huge contraction of the industry has made this a distressing time for anyone who loves the medium. 2023 was already a huge year for job losses in the industry, while 2024 is already shaping up to be worse. Kotaku is keeping a running tally of video game (and adjacent) layoffs, and by their count, we’re already approaching nearly 6,000 in the first month of the year.


It’s hard to say what our beloved hobby will look like when all of this finally slows down, but it’s rather difficult to stay optimistic.

The post Black Forest Games reportedly lays off roughly 50% of its employees appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Black Forest Games reportedly lays off roughly 50% of its employees

articles.author: Andrew Heaton
articles.description:
Last year, we reported that Twitch was introducing a new Partner Plus Program, which brought with it changes to how streamers are paid. While it was met with some praise, it was also criticized for certain threshold requirements. As a result, the company has implemented a few changes.


In a recent blog, Twitch announced its updated payouts for Partner Plus. For starters, it's now allowing Affiliated rather than just Partners to be included in the program. The changes also lower the threshold from 350 to 300, which means more streamers can qualify.




When the scheme began last October, it adjusted the 50/50 split to a 70/30 one, giving streamers more income. Now, with a lower threshold of 100 Plus Point (presumably this is in relation to how many subscribers channels have), a new Level 1 entry point will give content creators a 60/40 split, while Level 2 retains the 70/30 split.


Twitch has received "clear feedback"


Additionally, when the Partner Plus Program (which is dropping the "Partner" from the name) was first introduced, it put a cap on how much streamers could earn. In a nutshell, anyone whose revenue was $100k or more would go back down to the 50/50 split. This idea has now been scrapped.


The program was met with some backlash from the community, many of whom were concerned that the 350 subscriber threshold was unobtainable for many channels. Add onto that the income cap, and it was not Twitch's finest hour.


However, judging by responses to its Twitter thread on the news, it seems many are much happier with these new changes that will be coming into effect this May.

The post Twitch is expanding its Partner Plus Program, dropping the $100k cap appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Twitch is expanding its Partner Plus Program, dropping the $100k cap

articles.author: Michael Murphy
articles.description:
The Last of Us Part II's about to be seen in a whole new way. Grounded 2, a making-of documentary for The Last of Us Part II, premieres next week.

The documentary premieres at 9 a.m. PT / 12 p.m. ET for those waiting on the YouTube upload.


Hitting the ground running




As I used to study Game Design (and will pay monthly for around 10 years), I've been interested in behind-the-scenes of the game industry for a while. In fact, one of my favorite documentaries is Raising Kratos by PlayStation and Santa Monica. Can't get mo…
articles.title: Grounded 2, a making-of doc on The Last of Us: Part II, premieres next week

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
Depending on who you ask, indie games are the bread-and-butter of modern gaming, and there's certainly merit in that statement, as they serve niches that AAAs simply do not. Take stealth gaming, for example, which received something truly exciting just a few days back: Intravenous 2: Mercenarism.


Those of us who have been eagerly anticipating when on earth might Ubisoft finally announce a new Splinter Cell game may have missed the memo about Intravenous and its upcoming sequel, Intravenous 2. The mostly unknown stealth shooter from the developer HypeTrain Digital enjoys solid reviews, but it's the 2024 sequel that's really interesting here, mainly because it's got a top-tier demo you could start playing right this instant.


Image via HypeTrain Digital


What is Intravenous 2: Mercenaris…
articles.title: Intravenous 2: Mercenarism is the stealth game you’ve been waiting for (and it’s free)

articles.author: Timothy Monbleau
articles.description:
Nintendo's battle royale F-Zero 99 has been around the block for a few months now, but it's still seeing steady updates. As of the 1.2.0 update that went live on January 24, F-Zero 99 now includes an easier way to play with friends alongside a little surprise for more dedicated players.


The big feature of this update is the Private Lobby. This feature works exactly the way it sounds; any player who has completed the tutorial can now create or join their own private room right from the main menu. Simply select a game mode, enter a passcode, and you're in. 


Your room will auto-populate with CPU players once the countdown timer ends, so you don't actually need 99 people to make this feature work. Heck, if you just want to race by yourself against bots, you can do that here.




But what are the secret tracks in F-Zero 99?


The much more enigmatic addition via this patch is the addition of "secret tracks." So far, it appears that tracks titled "???" will randomly appear as you play online, complete with glitched-looking level icons. The tracks themselves seem to be mash-ups of existing tracks, with similarly mashed-up music to accompany them. Completing one of these will give you the "???" badge.




If you play enough, you should see one of these courses pop up sooner than later. As of writing, we're still learning more about how what each of these easter egg tracks looks like.


Additionally, update 1.2.0 also increases the max level cap to 399 (with numbers over 100 being marked with stars), and a new maximum skill rating of S50. Also, most importantly, the patch notes for this update state that Nintendo has "Fixed issues to make for a more pleasant gaming experience." Thanks for looking out for the pleasantness of my gaming experience, it means a lot!


F-Zero 99 is available now as part of the Nintendo Switch Online service.

The post F-Zero 99 1.2.0 update adds private lobbies and “secret tracks” appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: F-Zero 99 1.2.0 update adds private lobbies and “secret tracks”

articles.author: Steven Mills
